original_title: Sri Lanka’s Lankapay and Nepal’s Fonpay link up for cross-border payments
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s LankaPay, the island’s payment network operator, said it has tied up with Nepal’s Fonepay, to allow travellers to make QR based cross-border mobile payments in each other’s countries.
A memorandum of understanding between the two countries had been signed in a ceremony in the presence of Nilusha Dilmini, Charge d’Affaires, Sri Lanka Embassy in Kathmandu.
“With this strategic partnership, we aim to leverage our combined expertise in technology to empower the people of both nations,” Chief Executive of LankaPay, Channa de Silva said in a statement.
“This marks a historical step towards achieving interoperability in the digital payment space not only for Fonepay, but also for the entire country,” Biswas Dhakal, President of F1soft group said.
“The interoperability between Fonepay and LankaPay is not just about convenience; it is a catalyst for economic growth.

“We also urge the two governments to work on intensifying efforts to increase cross-country tourism, trade, and commerce now that we will have a foundation of interoperable payment systems between the two countries.”

Diwas Kumar Sapkota, Cheif Exective oif Fonepay was quoted as saying that the collaboration said the collaboration will help use technology to “unlock new opportunities, enhance financial inclusion, and create a thriving digital economy.”
